topics.title: ZeroSearch sub-topic
topics.body: Post suggestions, complaints or comments about ZeroSearch here

topics.title: ZeroNet Expands Key Distributed And Anonymous Features
Add sites to ZeroSearch here
topics.body:
Here you can post any sites that you want to add that aren't currently being indexed by zerosearch. 
Make sureÂ the site is hosted by other peers by checking if it still online after you turn your own computer off.
 Post your comment in this format:
(Site title, no more than 30 characters):(site address)

topics.title: Added ZeroSearch to Namecoin, you can now access it at zerosearch.bit

3@2.body: Add an upvote downvote and report button to zerotalk.
Make people's username's in zerotalk a link to their profiles.

@juicicoo "Is there something that can be done to improve the proxy usage? ie clicking on a localhost link while using the zeroproxy leads to the localhost link, instead of being proxied."

Currently, the site owners can add a code to their sites to make their links keep the proxies instead of always sending to localhost.  ZeroSearch is currently doing that, so you can get that code and add it to your site if you want.

1@6.body: I found it on a /r/bitcoin post nofish posted a few weeks ago.

1@35.body:
@Auios "Alright. So what if I want to use this account from another computer?"

You need to copy the public/private key in the data/users.json file to the other computer.  It creates a different one for each site you visit.

5@2.body:
> [nofish](#comment_34_2): Added upvote for topics and sub-topic groups.

~~How can we create sub-topics?~~

Is it currently possible for me to moderate my own sub-topic to do things like removing off-topic posts? 

And I just noticed we can upvote our own comments, leaving it with 2 points.  I think you should do it like reddit does and auto-upvote it leaving it with 1 point.

Edit:  I created one editing my data file and then publishing it manually.  Is there an easier way to do that?

16@2.body:
While that would look better, it would probably crash computers trying to display thousands of sites if zeronet gets popular.  

I could make it display the square links for the results, and as that is limited to 10, it shouldn't be hard to render.  The problem with that is that storing the images for each site gets big quickly, and 30,000 sites would be at around 1GB.

That could be solved by downloading the images dynamically for each result you need, instead of getting all images at once.  Not sure if that's currently possible with zeronet.

4@6.body:
> [Karsten](#comment_5_77): 1CP7VD25Z3W2nYzJ4CUcnTQt7YpMQW8dhT 

You should add a blog or something it's kinda empty right now :P 

Added it as "Karsten's site" as I'm not sure what you're going to put there, if you want to change it just tell me. 

> [Winter_Fox](#comment_5_82): Could you add my site? 17WUZGKQ1AhZLT8vENfWKb3ZvsrCAscsKg

 Added!

> [j](#comment_1_191): http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Atifm3m3wqUo7RqD2GPnyG6PKSxCk3g4c

You didn't set any title in your site, what do you want me to set it as?

1@139.body:
There is currently a chrome add on that makes http://zero/[address] access zeronet sites

You can find it here: https://github.com/goldenratio/zeronet-protocol-crx

You can also use Namecoin domains to access zeronet sites, for example you can access this site:

http://127.0.0.1:43110/1ZeroeuDnL2jNS6t1epQa1SPvC91KG8ER

by going to this url:

http://127.0.0.1:43110/zerosearch.bit

1@134.body:
There is this thread here in zerotalk for sharing your site:

http://127.0.0.1:43110/1TaLk3zM7ZRskJvrh3ZNCDVGXvkJusPKQ/?Topic:2@2/ZeroNet+sites

Not sure if there's a decentralized site for sharing sites, you can zerosearch for that if you don't mind it being centralized though.

19@2.body:
"[TA] There is no way to measure the total number," 

You could add google analytics to track how many users there are, I currently have it on zerosearch and it works well.

1@188.body: It doesn't send it directly through your browser. It first sends it using zeroframe (javascript code running on your browser) to the zeronet server running on your computer, and then finally sends it to other users hosting zerotalk.

1@274.body: Zeronet isn't that CPU intensive so porting it to C wouldn't have any real advantage. Also, as zeronet is a small project, writing it in C would really slow down development as python is a way quicker language to write in.
